definition: full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Farther ahead there were lanterns and candles alight while Zhang Fei drank in his tent.
sentences.chinese: 遥望张飞大明灯烛，正在帐中饮酒。

sentences.english: The night empty , take a distant view interstellar to cover with, look for each other of fixed position.
sentences.chinese: 夜朗空晴时，遥望星际漫天，寻觅彼此的定位。

sentences.english: Looking at the night sky, bright stars who don't admire infinite universe?
sentences.chinese: 遥望星光灿烂的夜空，谁不赞叹宇宙的无穷？

sentences.english: Only from afar can the height of its source be admired.
sentences.chinese: 唯有居远遥望才能赞叹其源头之高。

sentences.english: I looked down the road as far as I could.
It was midway between civilizations the looked to the Atlantic, as well as those that faced the .
sentences.chinese: 位于能遥望大西及面对太平洋的文明的的中间。

sentences.english: Different ages, we look into the distance with a moon.
sentences.chinese: 不同的年龄，我们遥望同一个月亮。

sentences.english: At Qi Chau nine cigarette, a cup of wine water.
sentences.chinese: 遥望齐洲九点烟，一泓海水杯中酒。

sentences.english: It's got a beautiful view overlooking the canal.
sentences.chinese: 这儿遥望到美丽的运河。

sentences.english: Looking to the language you use both the rise of the isolated city, hearts full of pain and pity.
sentences.chinese: 遥望你用文字砌起的孤城，心中满是疼痛和怜惜。

sentences.english: I often gazed toward the northland like a hero without fears.
sentences.chinese: 经常像个无畏的英雄遥望北国大地。

sentences.english: And with the knowledge that somewhere, someone sits looking up at the stars and hopes you are doing well, smile to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 时常想着某地某人正遥望星空，为你祈祷，对你微笑。

sentences.english: A person's wry smile, silly on from the tree a longing for the stars.
sentences.chinese: 一个人的苦笑，傻傻的依靠在树边遥望远方的星空。

sentences.english: Seen from afar, the cataract is shrouded in a gauzy mist, looking like a flickering mirage.
sentences.chinese: 遥望瀑布，笼罩在轻纱薄雾之中，幻景憧憧。

definition: to survey the scene from an elevated position
to gaze afar/to look into the distance
to gaze at/to stare fixedly at
to look up at/to look up to sb hopefully
as far as the eye can see
to stand for a long time
to raise one's head and look into the distance/fig. to forward to/to long for
